title: Computer Fundamental
learning_content: Computer Fundamentals What is Computer History of Computer Types of Computer.Computer Components, Input Devices, Output Devices, Central Processing Unit. Hardware, Software, Operating System.Computer Memory, Register Memory, Cache Memory, Primary Memory, RAM, ROM. Secondary Memory, Memory Units.Computer Network. Computer Virus.Important Softwares
introductory: The Computing Fundamentals examination covers a foundational understanding of computer hardware, software, operating systems, peripherals, and troubleshooting. It is designed to help you maximize the value and benefits of using computer technology.

title: Microsoft Office
learning_content: Microsoft Word.Microsoft Excel.Microsoft Powerpoint.One Drive.Access.Outlook.Publisher
introductory: Microsoft Office has become a leading platform to drive productivity at home and in the workplace. Whether it's managing email in Outlook, or building analysis spreadsheets in Excel, Office has made carrying out many computer based tasks easier for all of us.

title: Familiarity with IDE
learning_content: Installation of some famous IDE. In depth familiarity with VS Code.Familiarity with Atom.Familiarity with CodeBlocks,NetBeans,PyCharm.
introductory: IDE, formerly International Development Enterprises, is an international nonprofit organization that promotes a business approach to increasing income and creating livelihood opportunities for poor rural households.

title: Scratch Programming
learning_content: Getting Started with Scratch Programming.2 Small projects.3 complex projects.
introductory: Scratch is a high-level block-based visual programming language and website aimed primarily at children as an educational tool for programming, with a target audience of ages 8 to 16. Users on the site, called Scratchers, can create projects on the website using a block-like interface.

title: Get Started With C
learning_content: Getting started with C language.Problem Solving with C.2 small projects.3 large projects.
introductory: C is a general-purpose computer programming language. It was created in the 1970s by Dennis Ritchie, and remains very widely used and influential. By design, C's features cleanly reflect the capabilities of the targeted CPUs.

title: Basic Python
learning_content: Getting started with Python language.Problem Solving with Python.2 small projects.3 large projects.
introductory: Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation. Python is dynamically-typed and garbage-collected. It supports multiple programming paradigms, including structured, object-oriented and functional programming.

title: Learning JavaScript
learning_content: Getting started with JavaScript.Problem Solving with JavaScript.DOM Manipulation.3 small projects.4 complex projects.
introductory: JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS. As of 2022, 98% of websites use JavaScript on the client side for webpage behavior, often incorporating third-party libraries.

title: C++ Programming
learning_content: Getting started with C++ language.Problem Solving with C++.2 small projects.3 large projects.
introductory: C++ is a high-level general-purpose programming language created by Danish computer scientist Bjarne Stroustrup as an extension of the C programming language, or C with Classes.

title: HTML5 and CSS3
learning_content: Start with HTML.Dive into HTML5.Familiarity with Semantic Tags.Dive into CSS3.Flexbox,Grid.Animation with CSS.
introductory: Having a good grasp of HTML means you'll be able to create, present and edit a whole variety of content on the web. CSS3. CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) essentially 'enhances' HTML, giving developers and users more control over how pages and content is displayed.

title: JavaScript With ES6
learning_content: Advanced JavaScript.Problem solving with JavaScript.Dive into ES6.Solve Problem with ES6.3 projects with ES6.
introductory: JavaScript ES6 (also known as ECMAScript 2015 or ECMAScript 6) is the newer version of JavaScript that was introduced in 2015. ECMAScript is the standard that JavaScript programming language uses. ECMAScript provides the specification on how JavaScript programming language should work.

title: React
learning_content: Get started with React.Basic overview folder structure,component,props,jsx.React Router.React hooks.Authentication with React and Firebase.2 small projects.3 large projects.
introductory: React is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on UI components. It is maintained by Meta and a community of individual developers and companies

title: Node.js
learning_content: Dive into Node.js.Knowledge about server side programming.Work with Express.3 large projects.
introductory: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on a JavaScript Engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser, which was designed to build scalable network applications.

title: React Native
learning_content: Introduction to cross platform mobile application developement.Get started with React Native.Beginner to advance level.3 large projects with React Native.
introductory: React Native is an open-source UI software framework created by Meta Platforms, Inc. It is used to develop applications for Android, Android TV, iOS, macOS, tvOS, Web, Windows and UWP by enabling developers to use the React framework along with native platform capabilities.

title: Flutter
learning_content: Basic Dart programming.Cross platform mobile application developement basics.Dive into Flutter.Pull upto advance level.3 large projects.
introductory: Flutter is an open-source UI software development kit created by Google. It is used to develop cross platform applications for Android, iOS, Linux, macOS, Windows, Google Fuchsia, and the web from a single codebase. First described in 2015, Flutter was released in May 2017.

title: MySQL
learning_content: Introduction to Relational Database Management System.Basic sql queries.Advance sql queries.3 projects that are complex.
introductory: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system. Its name is a combination of My the name of co-founder Michael Widenius's daughter My, and SQL, the abbreviation for Structured Query Language.

title: MongoDB
learning_content: Introduction to Non Relational Database Management System. Dive into MongoDB. 4 large projects.
introductory: MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas. MongoDB is developed by MongoDB Inc. and licensed under the Server Side Public License which is deemed non-free by several distributions.

title: PostgreSQL
learning_content: Introduction to Relational Database Management System.Installation and setup PostgreSQL.3 projects that are complex.
introductory: PostgreSQL, also known as Postgres, is a free and open-source relational database management system emphasizing extensibility and SQL compliance. It was originally named POSTGRES, referring to its origins as a successor to the Ingres database developed at the University of California, Berkeley.

title: Basic Data Structure
learning_content: What is Data Structure?.Why should you learn Data Structure?.Linked List.Stack and Queue.Graph and Hash.Tree and Binary Tree.
introductory: In computer science, a data structure is a data organization, management, and storage format that is usually chosen for efficient access to data.

title: Basic Algorithms
learning_content: What is Algorithm?.Why should you learn Algorithms?.Time complexity.Space complexity.Sorting algorithms.Searching algorithms.Recursive algorithms.Brute Force algorithm.Greedy and Backtracking algorithm.
introductory: In Computer Science, an algorithm is a list set of instructions, used to solve problems or perform tasks, based on the understanding of available alternatives.

title: Object Oriented Programming
learning_content: What is Object Oriented Programming?.Basic Python.Start OOP with python.Know the 5 pillers of OOP.4 projects with OOP.
introductory: Object-oriented programming is a programming paradigm based on the concept of objects, which can contain data and code: data in the form of fields, and code, in the form of procedures. A common feature of objects is that procedures are attached to them and can access and modify the object's data fields.
